thread.title: Dalit boy committed suicide: Y’nagar police
thread.title_full: Dalit boy committed suicide: Y’nagar police

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Dalit boy committed suicide: Y’nagar police
text:
Our Correspondent
Yamunanagar, October 25
The police have claimed that Rajat of Daulatpur village of Yamunanagar district was not set afire by any person. He had committed suicide by setting himself on fire after a spat with his family members.
“I have submitted my inquiry report to Superintendent of Police Arun Singh and found that Rajat had committed suicide,” said Deputy Superintendent of Police Ajay Rana. Rajat died of burn injures on Wednesday and his father had alleged that his son was set afire by the sitting sarpanch of the village and members of his family on Tuesday night. The Radaur police booked the sitting sarpanch and five other members of his family on murder charge.
SIT probing incident: ADGP
Chandigarh: Muhammad Akil, ADGP, Law and Order, today stated that a special investigation team (SIT) was thoroughly investigating the incident in Daulatpur village of Yamunanagar district, wherein a youth, Rajat, was killed on the night of October 20.
The ADGP said the Yamunanagar police found out that the victim’s brother had called the SHO, Radaur, that his brother, who was in an inebriated state, was behaving in a rowdy manner.
Fearing an untoward incident, the SHO immediately sent a police team to the spot. However, when the team reached the spot, they found Rajat lying badly burnt in a lane.
The ADGP said the police immediately took the victim in their car to the General Hospital, Yamunanagar. However, they later shifted the victim to an ambulance plying on the same route and took him to the hospital. — TNS
